entry.def: Magnification is the act or process of magnifying something.

example.tran: 毛孔无须放大就可以看见。

example.ex: I find England strange and unique and beautiful. And for me, London is the magnification of all that.
example.tran: 我觉得英格兰可谓奇、绝、美。在我看来，伦敦在这些方面更为明显。

entry.def: Magnification is the degree to which a lens, mirror, or other device can magnify an object, or the degree to which the object is magnified.

example.ex: The electron microscope uses a beam of electrons to produce images at high magnifications...
example.tran: 电子显微镜利用电子束形成高倍影像。

example.ex: The magnification is 833,333 times the original size.
example.tran: 放大倍数为实物大小的833,333倍。

means.word_mean: 1. the act of expanding something in apparent size
2. the ratio of the size of an image to the size of the object
3. making to seem more important than it really is
4. a photographic print that has been enlarged

auth_sentence.content: He...expanded the image as far as the screen magnification would allow.
auth_sentence.res_content: He...expanded the image as far as the screen magnification would allow.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: He...expanded the image as far as the screen magnification would allow.

auth_sentence.content: The fibers are real and can be seen by anyone who looks with magnification.
auth_sentence.res_content: The fibers are real and can be seen by anyone who looks with magnification.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: The fibers are real and can be seen by anyone who looks with magnification.

auth_sentence.content: Mainly a matter of a magnification that we are not yet capable of today.
auth_sentence.res_content: Mainly a matter of a magnification that we are not yet capable of today.

stems_affixes.type_exp: 表名词,由ific变化而来,"产生,……化",通常在fy,ty结尾的动词后

stems_affixes.word_buile: ampl=ample充足的,详细的+ification产生,……化→放大后看得更加详细
glorify使更壮丽,赞扬+ification产生,……化→n.赞颂;美化
magn大+ification产生,……化→n.扩大,放大倍率
verify证实,查证的名词→n.确认,查证,作证

sentences.en: an image that is too small to be read without magnification
sentences.cn: 一种需要经过放大才可阅读的微小图象
